Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller752
Reviews.Content: Great Value for price. Good rooms for one (Max two). Good breakfast (Basic one), Great Front desk (Bobby & both ladies), Very helpful. Very near to airport ($10 by Taxi) and downtown San Diego. Next to Gas Lamp Quarters. Small aircrafts run over the property creating a sound, however stops early at night. Internet connectivity is poor. Great Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, acceptable experience, great price”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here on a quick San Diego getaway with a friend. We picked this hotel for the price primarily and the location secondarily. The price really cannot be beat. The location is great; for those driving from any of the rental agencies at the airport, it is about 5 minutes when no traffic. I was able to drive anywhere I went in San Diego in under 10 minutes (zoo, Coronado, Gaslamp District). The onramp to the I-5, which gets you just about anyplace else, is only a couple blocks away. The rooms are adquate. They seem dated, but not dirty. There is a room with shower/toilet and the sink is in the main sleeping area. The linens were clean, but there was a mold smell in my sink. That was my only complaint with the room. I slept well in the bed and was not terribly bothered by sleeping with the windows open at night. Re: outside noise...as others have mentioned this hotel is on the landing path of the airport. If you stand on the roof you could probably hit the planes by tossing tennis balls at them easily, they are about 10 seconds from landing when they pass over. But, the plane traffic stops around 11-11:30 at night and I didn't hear much before 6 a.m. This hotel also seems to attract nightlight/party lovers, who come in late and are loud. That happened two nights. But otherwise, I heard no traffic noise outside. There is no parking lot but that said, we had no problem finding an on-street space any night when we returned after 6 p.m. (when you no longer have to feed the parking meters). Yes, breakfast is included but it left a lot to be desired. We ate elsewhere the second two days because it sort of felt like a hostel. I'd stay here again if cutting costs was the only way I'd get to San Diego. It wasn't horrible, but not the best hotel experience I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't try to be what it's not”
Reviews.Author: Jenks19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located near Old Town and the Gas Lamp districts. About 1 /1/2 miles from the airport. It is a budget hotel which is great for people who just need a clean room and comfy bed, but are out sightseeing all day. No frills, but clean and adequate. Staff is friendly and helpful. There is a fair bit of noise from the street and late returning guests. With a downtown airport, the landing planes are so close it is disconcerting--but they stop fairly early each night. The continental breakfast is very, very basic--cereal, prepackaged danish, juice, coffee, bagels & toast. Skip it and head to Broken Yolk for a filling and reasonable breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Overall”
Reviews.Author: carol w
Reviews.Content: This jewel of a hotel is located minutes to the heart of San Diego America's Finest City and within walking distance of Balboa Park, a jewel of entertainment. The Staff goes overboard to accommodate your every need. A lovely breakfast is included. Each room has a kitchenette with fridge and microwave. Gym downstairs, beautiful courtyard with lush flowers and fountains. A business center and on site laundry. Wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: stayed just one night on 2-28-12..booked online directly with them about 1 month in advance. Had problem finding me system at first, but with conf # jumped right to it the room I had seemed a little small, it is basically a small bedroom with an attached bathroom and walk-in closet, where there is an under counter fridge, microwave and coffee maker Bathroom sink is really a bar sink with garbage disposal, very unusual but 100% functional The desk staff is friendly and very helpful, pointing me in the right direction to Little Italy and good food This place is no $500 a night hotel...it is exactly what it claims to be...a good bargain, with free wifi and a continental breakfast....I felt safe and slept soundly while there...I'll be back if ever in the area again

Reviews.Title: “great hotel compared to price”
Reviews.Author: Yanal S
Reviews.Content: compared to the price the level and service of this hotel is really good one, i booked in it 3 weeks in row clean room, smells good, great service . i even needed extra pillows and blanket at 5.00AM, i called the reception and after like 5 min they brought it to me , i guess the guys name is bobby he was so nice and friendly i recommend staying in it

Reviews.Title: “Good inexpensive choice in Central San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Aviatorstarboy
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice if you are looking for an inexpensive hotel option in the downtown area of San Diego that is easy to walk to. You are only 8 min walk to the trolley, and the bus stops one block from the hotel going downtown and three block on fifth ave if you are going to the Hillcrest area. The hotel is built around an open courtyard with external outside entrances to the rooms. You can hear and see the airlines landing on Rwy 27 at San Diego international just over this hotel, so putting your room fan on at night will create white noise so you can sleep. The rooms are on the small size, but well laid out. The breakfast is from 7-10 and is basic with pastries, fruit, cereals, tea, coffee, juice and milk. Internet is available via wi fi, and there is a machine in the lobby for those with out a computer. However there is a better option of using Kinkos downtown on C street for access and much cheaper. Good value for sure,and an easy walking hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is in the middle of crack town”
Reviews.Author: Charles M
Reviews.Content: If you like to be harassed, this is your place. I came home at 1:30 and they told me I wasn't staying there and to leave. After several minutes of pleading with the guy to let me in the security door, san diego's worst(cops) showed up. They then proceeded to threaten to arrest me if I didn't leave. So, I left, and I ended up staying on the streets of san diego until about 4:30 in the morning. When I came back the security door was open(thank God), so I went up to my room and grabbed my stuff and went to the airport. When I called the hotel's GM, and hotels.com, they told me it never happened. Basically, they were trying to steal my stuff. Stay here if you feel like being robbed. Never use hotels.com as they will only have the hotel's back. Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “NYE”
Reviews.Author: Merino L
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty small but it was a great price and everything in there looked nice and had wifi a flat screen tv. Down town is like 15mins away walking distance or you can take a taxi n you'll get there in like 5 mins. since the airport is near by you do hear the airplanes fly by but nothing major. The parking sucks because you have to park on the street and its free till 6pm in sections that have a meter.overall it was a great place for the price i would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Woofter186338
Reviews.Content: This was perfect for me - good location a few blocks from the trolley, downtown/Gaslamp district and also Balboa Park. Room was clean with all mod cons and the man at reception was very kind and helpful. Only negative was that the room was a bit on the small side - but overall, very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel. Better ones out there!!”
Reviews.Author: Lusana L
Reviews.Content: The staff here are not very friendly and helpful. (some are more then others). Location is not the best a bit to far from the downtown/gaslamp area. Walkable but far and streets are pretty dark. Taxi rides can be expensive to and from. Rooms are very clean but very small. And weekends people from other rooms have party's and go out etc and it is very noisy had I to ring down stairs to ask them to tell others to be quite however they already knew this and neighbors were still very loud!! Breakfast was very ordinarily not much choice we didn't eat there once didn't look very clean. Overall I think there are better hotels closer to downtown/gaslamp area for around the same price and probably with better service!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff, Crappy Guests”
Reviews.Author: mariasolis1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Veteran's Day weekend for a relaxing weekend with the hubby. The entire staff here was excellent, the place was spotless and everybody greeted you will a smile. The problem was the guests. Being that this building seems to have been a former apartment building the walls are thin. Had someone two doors down wake us up late in the night when he decided to be extremely loud. Thankfully there was a tough marine manning the desk and kept these folks in line but unfortunately, once you walk my husband up it is nearly impossible for him to go back to sleep and made for a cranky touring buddy. Our last night there we had a couple going into a full fledged argument that woke us up. Screams and insults were hurled, furniture was thrown, doors were slammed and of course I made a call to the front desk. Took about another 30 minutes for them to calm down. Husband and I could not go back to sleep. Give it another 30 minutes and the couple of course "made up" if you know what I mean. I did not get to sleep at all all three nights here. They need to do a a better job of soundproofing the walls and also have better blinds to block out the sun. I have no other qualms than this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: gsaave
Reviews.Content: I keep coming back to this place because they make me feel at home. Bobby, always treats me nice with a big smile and make sure that I am happy with the services and accomodations. Alex is another great person to meet. He makes you smile with his jokes. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotell close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: hilde_nilsen
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotell included breakfst, close to Gaslamp and seaport village and Balboa park.5 min walking to down town Some noise from the airport was a little minus, but it was not a big problem.In the night the airport close. The room was very clean, but not very big. The service was very good, and we liked Bobby very much.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Bobby”
Reviews.Author: Salian C
Reviews.Content: I find the stay at this hotel very but very comfortable, perfect location, would like to thank the frontdesk guy, named Bobby, for his warm welcome and generiosity.We chose this hotel almost because of him, so thank you Bobby and keep working and smiling like only you know. see u soon

Reviews.Title: “Plane spotters paradise!”
Reviews.Author: WAW-YMX-YUL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Americas Best Value Inn on 4th Avenue in San Diego for a week and overall, I'm glad I did. The hotel is a short 15-minute walk from the Gaslamp Quarter, about 20 minutes from the Santa Fe Depot (uphill, ouch!) and less than 10 minutes from the restaurants of Little Italy. Also close to Balboa Park and bus stop. I checked in an hour earlier and was given the key to my room right away which was nice. If you're like me and LOVE aviation, you will love this hotel. San Diego has an airport almost right in downtown and you can see a variety of colorful airplanes land right from your window (ask for a high-floor room with windows facing North) which is very cool. On a lazy day, I would just open the window and take pictures! If you intend to sleep during the day, however, the airplane noise will probably bother you... but did you really come to San Diego to sleep your stay off? Last flights land shortly after midnight so noise won't bother most people. On this stay, I was given room 505, which is a small, recently-renovated single room with all the amenities (good A/C system, fridge, coffee maker, ironing board, etc.). The room is much smaller than what you expect in a hotel room, but I didn't need much more space anyways (solo traveler). Room service was efficient although I only used it once during my stay. I left the "do not disturb" card on the door and wasn't bothered. Bathoom has shower and toilet; sink is located in the room itself in the "kitchenette area". Would have liked the shower head to be adjustable so I could wash better. Daily breakfast is rather poor (would have liked one or two hot items) but replenished multiple times. It consists of orange juice, ice tea, coffee, milk, bottled water, commercial breakfast cereal, sweet buns, grape jam, peanut butter, bagels, toasts, Philadelphia cheese, apples, oranges. There were butter croissants on my last day. Hotel guests generally consist of international leisure travelers. I saw 3 women from France, 4 Indian women, a couple from the UK. Also encountered a Swiss student who was staying there for 3 months. Weekend had some young adult couples partying but nothing too bothersome. Yes, there are homeless people down the street... never bothered me so it's a non-issue. The check-out was smooth as well but I found the Hispanic reception lady very incompetent. I had just stayed at the hotel for a week and wanted to book an extra night in 2 days. I enquired about their best rate but she did not offer me anything close to their best rate (or even a good rate) and I almost had to argue to get the 15% discount given to their frequent-guest programme members about which she clearly had no clue. In the end, she just told me to book on Expedia. Pretty incompetent and clueless to me! PROS: Good value (price/location) for San Diego, clean recently-renovated (but small) room, cool interior court. CONS: Poor customer service makes guests feel unwelcomed (the reception lady doesn't seem to care at all and some maids will leave their service carts in the middle of the hall, preventing guests with luggage to access their rooms), breakfast is very basic and plain, interior court is NOT smoke-free. Overall, Americas Best Value Inn Downtown San Diego does it right. There is room for improvement but I would (and did; see my second review) stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous T
Reviews.Content: All of the staff here are friendly and helpful. Alex was particularly helpful. He went out of his way to sort out a problem we had (Thank you so much Alex!) The rooms and all other areas are clean and well-kept. The breakfast was decent. It's in a good location. This place is good value for the money. My husband and I are returning guests...we stayed here the previous summer. We will probably stay here next summer as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with airplanes landing until midnight”
Reviews.Author: Trackstars
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, attractive, comfortable and the staff are great. The location is close to everywhere I needed to be. There is NO HOTEL PARKING except on the street at meters and meters are off from 6PM to 8AM. Our problem was airplanes are very low at this point in the landing process. They stop landing at midnight. Until then, you will hear them every 5 to 10 minutes. Good luck with that.

Reviews.Title: “Read this before booking !”
Reviews.Author: Nelsonblanca083
Reviews.Content: Depending on what's important to you in a hotel, I would NEVER recommanded this hotel to anyone ! I travel a lot (10 times a year) and I've been to lots of hotel and saw crapy rooms. If it was only that, I would't take the time to write a review. Let me explain. First of all, the customer service at this hotel is terrible ! We've asked to change room, it took 2 days ! We ask for an extra blanket, they had none and told us we had one on our bed !! You just feel like they don't care about you or your confort. I would also say that it's a cheap hotel, therefore, lots of young adult who party every night, are drunk at the hotel's entrance and made lots of noises until 3 AM everynight !!! Horrible, we couldn't sleep. For the room. it's standard, really really small, and not confortable with cold water ! The only cool thing is the flat screen TV, and it's not that clean.... And forget about the breakfast, it's disgusting. Don't go there, in San diego, I'm sure you could fine something better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place - a great value with super staff”
Reviews.Author: bkm2774
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this property three times this year - and I have been amazed each time. It has a beautiful courtyard full of palm trees and ferns. The rooms are European sized and nice - very clean It is a 20min walk or a $6 cab ride to the Convention Center or downtown activities. It's a hidden treasure - great place. B Murphy Fredericksburg, Tx

Reviews.Title: “Functional, utilatarian, great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: barbLancaster_WI
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Inn in the small but clean rooms. The staff and front desk folks were helpful and friendly. The mini fridge,light breakfast & coutyard were nice perks. The Sunday we checked out my husband left his cell phone in the room. With a call back to the front desk the phone was retrieved from the room. On Monday general manager, Neal Singh fefdexed it to Wisconsin. Tuesday the phone was back in my husband's pocket. Excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is nice, Rooms...are not.”
Reviews.Author: moment2late
Reviews.Content: We intended on staying at this hotel from a Thursday to a Monday, we only ended up staying one horrifying night. The second we walked into even the neighborhood of this hotel we knew it was going to be bad. There were homeless people everywhere. When we arrived at our hotel immediately we knew that it was one of those hotels that people live in. Our FIRST room, yes I sai first room, had a broken light in the room, no sink or mirror in the bathroom. The only mirror was way to high to even see in unless you stood on a chair. When attempting to leave to go out that night the door would not lock. It took 45 mintues for a staff member to come up just to tell us that he could not fix it. He stated that he would get us a new room. When he was looking up rooms they only had a full size bed left, we had a queen originally. He also described the room to be "clean", I looked at him in disgust just thinking well i hope it is clean. When telling us where the next room would be he said it was in the next building that was gated and you needed a code to get in (that was the only good thing about where the new room was located, until we found out that it was right outside of the gate!) When entering our new room it looked like an old office, it was not a normal door it was a glass door like you would see in a business with one key lock, spray painted white so you could not see in. The sheets had writing on them in permanent marker, the toilet did not work very well, the sink had stains all over it. This stay ruined our whole first night in San Diego. That night we found a way more beautiful, clean hotel and booked that for the rest of the trip. When I called the GM just recently he was nice and was able to refund the full amount for that one horrible night!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting....”
Reviews.Author: LAEPATTY
Reviews.Content: I planned to stay there 30 days ...... Impossible ...... The room was dirty and my socks got brown after a walk to the restroom. The noise is so high becouse of the planes. My neighbour was a noisy family whith 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away: bedbug unfestation”
Reviews.Author: GovTrav0
Reviews.Content: Hotel is infested with bugs, including bedbugs. While administration is aware of the problem, they do minimum to take care of the problem and are being uncooperative, when you try to ensure that you are not carrying bugs with you. If you nonetheless decide to stay at the hotel, make sue to inspect the room, bed, sheets, sink etc. Administration, including headquarters is not very cooperative in resolving the problem. While they reimburse your stay if you complain, they refuse to take care of you cleaning bills etc. If you see any signs of bugs, including blood spots on the sheets in the morning make sure to take pictures! Otherwise they would claim that "no signs of infestation" was found! Moreover, the hotel is right on the way of the plane approach glissade to San Diego airport, which makes sleep fairly difficult. DO NOT STAY THERE, DO NOT SPREAD BED BUGS AROUND.

HotelInfo.Name: Americas Best Value Inn - San Diego Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1840 4th Avenue, San Diego, CA 92101 (Formerly West Park Inn)
